level_1.1: This is a Caesar Cipher, and it is one of the earliest and simplest methods of encryption technique
level_1.2: A Caesar Cipher is a type of substitution cipher
level_1.3:
Each letter of a given text is replaced by a 
letter with a fixed number of positions down the alphabet

level_3.2:
When all 4bits are ON  (1 1 1 1 = 2^3 + 2^2 + 2^1 + 2^0)
When all 4bits are OFF (0 0 0 0 = 0 + 0 + 0 + 0
level_3.3: Hamming weights are the number of bits that are turned ON in a binary string

level_4.1: Rail Fence Cipher is an encryption method zig-zaging letters between rails
level_4.2: The key to a Rail Fence Cipher is the number of rails you need to use
